programme.desc: Gnasher and Gnipper enter a dog show, regardless of Walter saying they don't have true talent. He wants Athena and Miss Mini Wuff to win, but Walter has just underestimated Gnasher's true capabilities. Followed by Grounded.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Athena gets Gnasher envy when seeing a pampered version of Gnasher in a magazine and when she hears that Dennis owns an Abyssinian wire-haired tripe hound (Gnasher), she wants him. However, being an owner to Gnasher isn't all cracked up to be! Followed by 'Splash'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis gets a case of the hiccups from Mr. Har Har's can-o-giggles and is looking for a way to cure them ready for a film premier. Followed by Athena's Party

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: The garden is accidentaly wrecked when Dennis tries to give Gnasher a bath, so the gang have to fix the mess before Mum comes home. Followed by 'Run Rabbit Run'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis makes a line of practical jokes for Mr. Scrimp, called 'The Menace Collection.' However, Dennis soon learns that it will put Mr. Har Har out of business.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After Walter takes up origami as a martial art, Dennis scoffs and comes up with his own martial art, and so the two prepare to battle it out. Followed by 'Smelling of Roses'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After watching a film about an alien invasion, Dennis, Curly and Pie Face decide to make their own film. However, Walter stumbles across them filming, and he only sees the action, not the camera. Filming what he sees on his mobile phone, he runs to tell the whole of Beanotown about the alien invasion. As panic spreads, Dennis and his friends discover the chaos and decide to keep filming in order to help make the best of their own alien film. Meanwhile, Sergeant Slipper investigates the alien landing that Walter has seen, and discovers the truth—that the spaceship is a playhouse with glow sticks in it. Followed by 'Castle in the Air'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis and his pet dog, Gnasher, live by just one rule: Kids should make all the rules! Followed by Dance of the Seven Pies.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: To get his friends back from Walter's group, Dennis challenges Walter to a videogames battle. Followed by 'Fish Tale'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: For a school project, Dennis and Walter both build robots. However, during an accident, both robots merge, causing Dennis and Walter to defend the school. Followed by 'No Joke.'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: With one backstage pass for a Ratbucket gig, Dennis and his friends pass themselves off as Ratbucket, only for the real Ratbucket not to be able to play at his own concert. Followed by 60 second Dennis and 'Bad Dad'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After Dennis breaks his bike, Dad is unable to afford a new one, so Dennis convinces him to ask his boss for a raise. Unfortunately, Mr Scrimp reduces his wages instead. Dennis then trashes his house to convince Scrimp that his family are poor, so that Mr Scrimp will feel compelled to raise Dad's wages. Just as Scrimp has been taken in by Dennis' plan, Mum and Dad arrive home laden with shopping bags, resulting in Dad getting fired on the spot. Dennis resolves to get Dad his old job back by secretly causing chaos at his office. To restore order Scrimp rehires Dad, sealing the deal with a generous pay rise. Mum and Dad repair the house, but still don't have enough money to buy Dennis a new bike, instead it gets repaired with Dad's office rubber bands and paperclips. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Dennis Hiccups'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Believing Gnasher and Gnipper to be trapped in Beanotown Dog Pound, Dennis comes up with a plan to rescue his friends and bring them both home. Followed by more Dennis and Gnasher episodes.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: When Dennis breaks his skateboard again, Dad agrees to buy Dennis the best skateboard there is as a replacement if he is able to win a prize at the upcoming school award ceremony. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Dance of the Seven Pies'

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Jokey's Cloak: What is in the box that's been found by Jokey Smurf? A cloak belonging to Wizlow the Magician gnome. And what sort of cloak? Jokey learns that it's a cloak of invisibility. Whoever wears it has a great opportunity of playing practical jokes... And guess what havoc an invisible Jokey is able to wreak on the Village. Yet if Wizlow parted with the cloak, there must be a reason...

programme.title: Beauty Is Only Smurf Deep
programme.desc: Periwinkle, a vain Pixie, is upset when her magic mirror tells her that Vanity is the fairest, not she. Periwinkle kidnaps Vanity, but the rest of the Smurfs come to Vanity's rescue. Periwinkle sees the error of her ways and they become friends.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Supersmurf: Bigmouth steals the Smurfs' winter food supply and Brainy concocts one of Papa Smurf's magic strength potions so he can fight the greedy giant. The super formula wears off, but Papa Smurf works a fast switch, replacing the food with rocks and Bigmouth is none the wiser.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - A Circus For Baby: It must be a coincidence: just as an elephant crosses the forest and meets baby Smurf, the Smurfs decide to create a big Smurf Circus. They are going to meet the infernal sorcerer Balthazar and Baby Smurf will have a lot of fun...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Golden Smurf Award: Hogatha disguises herself as the Golden Smurf Award to catch the Smurfs in order to use them as the main ingredient in her beauty cream. Vanity convinces her to try his recipe and before long, the wicked sorceress is covered with mud and sent careening over the hills into Gargamel's house.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Comet Is Coming!: Papa's note to the Smurfs about viewing a comet is delivered torn. The Smurfs read only the first part and think their world is coming to an end. They plan how to spend their last day until Papa returns to clear up the misunderstanding and assure them that they are safe.

programme.title: Foul Weather Smurf
programme.desc: Handy invents a weather machine that will allow the Smurfs to control their environment at will. Unfortunately, they cannot agree on whether it should rain or be sunny so the machine overloads and explodes.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Most Unsmurfy Games: To prove the worth of his Big Book of Wilderness Survival, Brainy takes the Smurflings to the swamp. Where, thanks to his expert advice, the tiny group gets totally lost, is then caught in quicklime and trapped by King Bullrush of the Wartmongers. Fortunately, Bullrush is in a playful mood and devises a Smurf hunt. Unfortunately, Brainy believes he is a born leader...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Root Of Evil: If there is one thing that the evil sorceress Chlorhydris cannot abide, it is other people's happiness. The spectacle of the Smurfs' gentle and song-filled life gets Chlorhydsis' hackles up. She must destroy that tinkling laughter, smother those happy repartees... She plants the root of evil in the forest and soon, no Smurf is on speaking terms with another. Baby Smurf is the only one untouched...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurfing For Gold: Gargamel the evil wizard is in trouble again. If he can't find an enormous amount of gold by sundown, all his possessions will be taken away from him. But the Smurfs are going to help their arch-enemy... Up to a point.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Baby Smurf Is Missing: Thinking Baby Smurf is a leprechaun, two poachers kidnap him and try to get the small one to tell them where his pot of gold is hidden. Papa Smurf organizes everyone to attack the villains with Smurfberry pies so Baby can escape.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Royal Drum: No one believes Grandpa Smurf when he tells of far-away jungles and savannahs teeming with wild giant cats, striped horses, long-necked leaf-eaters and strange tribes... Only some Smurflings give some credit to his tales. But when Grandpa Smurf hears the sound of the magic Royal Drum in the forest, the one that can tame wild beasts, he sets out to prove that he's not an old addle-brained storyteller.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurf A Mile In My Shoes: The Smurfs band together to retrieve a sea-shell they need to release a hermit imp from the Sea Witch, as she cursed him with ugliness and a language very few understand. The Smurfs return with the sea-shell in time to break the curse and return the hermit to the handsome imp he once was.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurfette's Dancing Shoes: An evil imp gives Smurfette dancing shoes and then tricks her into promising to marry him. All her little friends rush to her rescue and Papa Smurf magically puts the dancing shoes on the imp. He is forced to dance off into the night.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurfette's Golden Tresses: Hogatha, the repulsive witch, captures the Smurfette. She wants to steal from the little blue beauty her golden hair. Can the Smurfs save their little female companion before it is too late? Can Hogatha grow hair like Smurfette's?

programme.title: Return To Don Smurfo
programme.desc: When a drop of Papa Smurf's new potion spills on the Smurflings' adventure book, the fictional hero springs to life. The dashing Don Smurfo, willing to rid the Smurf of the evil Gargamel, gallantly captures him...

programme.title: Dreamy's Pen Pals
programme.desc: When Dreamy decides to visit his friends, the Swoofs, Papa develops a potion to turn the Smurfs into alien-like creatures. But when the potion wears off to soon, Dreamy has to face the reality that the Swoofs do not exist. He is sad until a real alien arrives, returning Dreamy's letter that was delivered by mistake.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurfette's Rose: Smurfette promises Mother Nature that if she creates a blue rose Smurfette will never cut it. But when the white rose becomes blue, Smurfette becomes white. The only way to make Smurfette blue again is for her to cut the rose. She reluctantly cuts the rose, returning nature to normalcy and learning that one cannot always keep a promise.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Every Picture Smurfs A Story: The evil Maestro's magical paints have the power to transport his models onto canvas – forever! Papa Smurf directs Painter to switch his paints and before long, Maestro is enshrined in a picture next to his dream girl, Smurfette.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Poet And Painter: Because they feel unappreciated, Poet and Painter leave Smurf Village and head for Storm Island, totally unaware that Gargamel is planning to trap them. Papa Smurf and his faithful volunteers rescue their friends.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - All's Smurfy That Ends Smurfy: Gargamel's theft of the Fairies' gold almost brings a state of war between the Fairies and the Smurfs.

programme.title: How To Smurf A Rainbow
programme.desc: Mother Nature is too busy to conjure a rainbow for the Smurfs' festival, so Papa Smurf borrows her cookbook and mixes up the recipe himself. As there is no yellow available, they use the leprechaun's gold to produce a beautiful rainbow before Gargamel can steal it.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Gargamel The Generous: In an effort to find out where the Smurfs' secret diamond stash is hidden, Gargamel pretends to be their friend. When he shows his true, wicked self, Papa Smurf works a magic spell to save his little Smurfs from the vicious clutches of the evil wizard.

programme.title: All The News That's Fit To Smurf
programme.desc: Curious Smurf has an idea: why not print a sheet with all the Village news? He's sure to interest all his readers of the Smurf Tattler. But things don't go exactly to plan when Papa finds super smurfberries.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Born Rotten: As the Smurfs prepare for the Festival of the Stars, Gargamel plants a creature in their midst that smells so rotten that he can easily be traced to the Smurf village. Papa Smurf realizes that Born Rotten is from another planet, and he instructs Feathers to return him to his home before Gargamel finds them.

programme.title: Speak For Yourself, Farmer Smurf
programme.desc: Farmer hides his love for Smurfette by assuming a disguise and sending her poems. When they finally meet, they are captured by Bigmouth and in their struggle to get free, they discover their mutual friendship.

programme.title: The Trojan Smurf
programme.desc: Gargamel, the evil wizard, has devised a new plan to capture the Smurfs: he builds a giant statue in the shape of Papa Smurf. Thus, he hopes, the Smurfs are going to drag the statue into their Village.

programme.title: The Littlest Witch
programme.desc: On an errand to Witch Haven for Papa Smurf, the little blue creatures meet a tiny witch and teach her how to be good while at the same time cause another witch to lose her wicked powers for one year after she falls into the river.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - One Good Smurf Deserves Another: Handy Smurf has saved Clumsy from a horrible fate. Clumsy swears eternal devotion to his savior and does his best to repay his debt… With awkward results. A clever scheme is needed to stop Clumsy's well-meant catastrophes...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Miracle Smurfer: The Smurfs learn that the mind is more powerful than matter when they are fooled by a quack's outrageously expensive miracle tonic. But Papa Smurf cures the Smurfs of their temporary naiveté and the charlatan of his villainy.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Adventures Of Robin Smurf: The Smurfs' theatrical production of 'Robin Smurf' comes to life as the legendary hero is portrayed by a really good actor...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Littlest Viking: The Smurfs take Grandpa Smurf to the King's castle so that he can meet Peewit. But what with one thing and another (especially another), the Smurfs and Peewit are taken aboard a Viking long ship. The Vikings take Peewit to be their mythical Great Warrior, the one who is going to vanquish the Storm King. Can the Smurfs help Peewit out of his quandary?

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurf The Other Cheek: Hefty Smurf meets an old Trolless in the forest, and the old crone begs him to relieve her of a red spot on her nose by... giving her a good kick here and now! Hefty half-heartedly obliges... And the result is a big surprise for him!

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Put Upon Puppy: Life in the Smurf Village might be more peaceful if Puppy's behavior were a little more considerate. But the little Smurf dog is digging up Smurfette's flowers, dirtying Vanity's new wallpaper or ruining Papa Smurf's experiments. Yet Puppy's going to help the Smurfs out of a trap contrived by Gargamel... Or maybe he won't be disciplined enough...

programme.title: The Magic Stick
programme.desc: With a borrowed recipe from Homnibus, Papa Smurf creates a magic stick that Clumsy takes and loses in the woods. Soon after, Bigmouth comes for a visit and before he eats all the smurfberries, Papa Smurf finds the magic stick and whisks the giant away.

programme.title: The Smurfs And The Money Tree
programme.desc: The wicked wizard Gargamel has come up with yet another diabolical plan with the help of his mother, who isn't much nicer than him. He wants to tempt the Smurfs with money of which they have no notion. Will Greedy take the bait?

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurfette For A Day: Hefty dresses like Smurfette to lure an enamored gnome, Piltkin, away from the Smurf Village. They burrow underground and meet a female gnome who falls in love with Piltkin who then casts Smurfette aside for his new heartthrob.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Once In A Blue Moon: Once in a blue moon, as the legend goes, a baby Smurf is delivered to the Smurfs and everyone in the village becomes attached to the new arrival. But a mistake has been made and the stork returns to take the baby back. Grouchy and Smurfette have become so attached to the baby that the baby is returned.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Kow-Tow, We Won't Bow: Smurfette leads the Smurflings on a nature hike, but Puppy gets too far ahead and they chase him into the land of the Wartmongers. King Bullrush captures them in bubbles and imprisons them. A group of rebels rescue the Smurflings and they escape on the back of Puppy.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Dark-Ness Monster: When Brainy loses his glasses, he drops things, runs into objects, and becomes just as helpless as Clumsy, who now has to read to Brainy and help him get around. This experience makes Brainy feel guilty for the way he always made fun of Clumsy. He treats him with more respect once he receives a new pair of glasses.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Born Rotten: As the Smurfs prepare for the Festival of the Stars, Gargamel plants a creature in their midst that smells so rotten that he can easily be traced to the Smurf village. Papa Smurf realizes that Born Rotten is from another planet, and he instructs Feathers to return him to his home before Gargamel finds them.

programme.title: Brainy Smurf, Friend To All Animals
programme.desc: Brainy dons his safari hat and roams the forest to do good deeds for animals. He mostly gives advice to the creatures but balks when he can really save the life of a wildcat being hunted by Gargamel. Nat gives Brainy the courage to free the cat from Gargamel's trap.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Calling Dr Smurf: As his name implies, Dabbler Smurf is incapable of staying put in any one activity. He goes from one pursuit to another with the greatest of ease and never finishes what he's begun. But suddenly here he is smitten by the love of the medical profession. Dabbler wants to become a doctor and all of the Smurfs, with Papa Smurf in the lead, are going to help him to achieve his wish.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Locomotive Smurfs: Handy Smurf has hit on a revolutionary new idea: a sort of smurfless carriage that moves on railroad tracks. He calls it a railsmurfer and it makes for less work in the Village... until Gargamel chances upon it.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - All Hallowseve: While out on a mischief-making mission to destroy the Smurfs' Happy Halloween party, Gargamel and Hogatha catch Lazy who has been accidentally turned red by Mother Nature. Papa and the Smurfs help Lazy escape while Mother Nature has Father Time help turn Lazy's red into blue just in time for the Halloween party.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Sideshow Smurfs: Clumsy and Smurfette are captured by the wicked Bombast, who plans to exhibit them in his sideshow. Papa Smurf hurries to their rescue and using the bungling Gargamel for interference is able to rescue his Smurfs.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Master Smurf: There is an evil power in the Titan's crown that Miner Smurf finds underground. And Greedy Smurf is the Smurf to fall victim to it. Then Gargamel comes up with some new schemes to destroy the Smurfs, and everything gets hopelessly tangled.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Most Popular Smurf: Jokey's surprise exploding packages have been changed by a spell. Picture the practical joker's discombobulating when he realises that all the surprises that he hands to unsuspecting Smurfs contain nothing but real gifts! No more ka-boom, no more jokes, no more fun! Plus the unenviable new position of Most Popular Smurf in the Village, surrounded by admirers begging for more presents...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Tattle-Tail Smurfs: Brainy Smurf's had enough. The Smurflings and Sassette keep on telling tales about him with unpleasant results. He therefore concocts a magic formula, taken from Papa Smurf's books of spells, which makes the little Smurfs' tails grow longer and longer every time they tell tales. What he hasn't counted on is that Gargamel now has a way of catching the Smurflings.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Magic Rattle: The Smurfs help a fairy queen outwit the evil fairy Fallon who tries to take away her son's magic rattle.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Chip Off The Old Smurf: Disaster strikes when Brainy and Baby mix up Papa Smurf's formulas, leaving them powerless before an army of hungry locusts unleashed on the forest by Gargamel.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Smurfstone Quest: In the distant valley of Nodrog, the Smurfs meet the Molians who try to dissuade them from obtaining the magical Smurf-stone that Papa Smurf needs to cure his gout.

programme.title: Monster Smurfs
programme.desc: This is spook-a-Smurf eve, and all the Smurfs get ready for the fancy dress party… But Brainy Smurf gets hold of Papa Smurf's Book of Magic, and all the Smurfs are changed into hideous but funny creatures. Yet danger lurks...

programme.title: Hefty And The Wheelsmurfer
programme.desc: Hefty Smurf learns what is to be handicapped when he breaks his leg. Handy Smurf creates the wheelsmurfer for him, a contraption that will give Hefty some mobility. But suddenly the evil wizard Gargamel appears on the scene.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - All The Smurf's A Stage: Poet Smurf's new play is going to be his greatest work ever, and it will feature the most favourite Smurf of all: Smurfette in the leading female role. All the other Smurfs vie for the honour of playing opposite Smurfette. Even Timid Smurf, who is the shy and retiring type, is a candidate for the part. Brainy Smurf, self-appointed manager of the play, does not see it that way...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Littlest Viking: The Smurfs take Grandpa Smurf to the King's castle so that he can meet Peewit. But what with one thing and another (especially another), the Smurfs and Peewit are taken aboard a Viking long ship. The Vikings take Peewit to be their mythical Great Warrior, the one who is going to vanquish the Storm King. Can the Smurfs help Peewit out of his quandary?

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurf A Mile In My Shoes: The Smurfs band together to retrieve a sea-shell they need to release a hermit imp from the Sea Witch, as she cursed him with ugliness and a language very few understand. The Smurfs return with the sea-shell in time to break the curse and return the hermit to the handsome imp he once was.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Once In A Blue Moon: Once in a blue moon, as the legend goes, a baby Smurf is delivered to the Smurfs and everyone in the village becomes attached to the new arrival. But a mistake has been made and the stork returns to take the baby back. Grouchy and Smurfette have become so attached to the baby that the baby is returned.

programme.title: Clumsy Luck
programme.desc: The Smurfs learn about superstition when Clumsy breaks Vanity's mirror prior to a meteor shower. When a meteor falls on Clumsy's house, everyone attributes it to bad luck, but realize the foolishness of this philosophy when they see Clumsy was not in the house at the time.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Sassette's Tooth: Oh dear! Sassette has lost a tooth. Papa Smurf explains that if she puts her tooth under her pillow, the Mouse Fairy will bring her a present in the morning. But the next morning there is no present under the pillow. The Mouse Fairy has not been. She has been captured in one of Gargamel's Smurf traps. And now the evil wizard is concocting a dreadful plan.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Crying Smurfs: Everybody can make a mistake. Take Papa Smurf, for instance. His new perfume-enhancing spray makes a rose smell like a thousand roses...but due to a whole series of misadventures it also makes all the Smurfs cry, moved to tears by the slightest of pretexts. While they sob, bawl, wail moan and whimper, the evil wizard Gargamel does not stand still...

programme.title: The Great Lime Crop Failure
programme.desc: Bullrush the Wartmonger is in a panic because the lime harvest has failed. So he captures Farmer Smurf, the world's greatest agricultural expert, to solve his problems. Farmer Smurf installs an irrigation system and saves the harvest. He then escapes in a bubble and returns to the Smurfs.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurfette's Flowers: It's not every day you meet a talking flower. Especially not a character like Petaluma, a somewhat haughty bulb flower who Smurfette meets in the forest. Of course the delighted Smurfette takes Petaluma to the Village of the Smurfs... and starts a process that is going to endanger all of the Smurfs. Flowers, it seems, ought to be seen and not heard.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Miracle Smurfer: The Smurfs learn that the mind is more powerful than matter when they are fooled by a quack's outrageously expensive miracle tonic. But Papa Smurf cures the Smurfs of their temporary naiveté and the charlatan of his villainy.
